alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 16 at 10:00PM MDT until April 19 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Emigration Creek Near Salt Lake City affecting Salt Lake County. .Warm temperatures Sunday and Monday and rain on snow Tuesday will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For Emigration Creek...including Salt Lake City`s East Bench... action stage is forecast. Flood stage is possible Monday night into Tuesday morning and again Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt remains expected. * WHERE...Emigration Creek Near Salt Lake City. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 130 CFS, minor flood damage will impact homes and structures along the stream, including areas of the Hogle Zoo. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Current flow is 94 CFS and rising. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage through Wednesday morning with a maximum value of 141.0 cfs early Wednesday morning. Peak flows have typically been occurring during the evening and early overnight hours each day. - Action flow is 110 cfs. - Flood flow is 130 cfs. &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday at 1200 PM MDT.
